title: Pelsall Common Walking Route

images.title: John M / Pool on Pelsall Common
images.caption: Pool on Pelsall Common. The northern corner of Pelsall Common was the site, until the 1920s, of Pelsall Ironworks with blast furnaces, puddling furnaces, forges and rolling mills. The site has now reverted to nature.

images.title: John M / Heathland on Pelsall Common
images.caption: Heathland on Pelsall Common. Pelsall Ironworks occupied the common in the late nineteenth century.

images.title: John M / Friars Bridge, Hatherton Branch Canal
images.caption: Friars Bridge, Hatherton Branch Canal. This 6.5 mile canal originally linked the Staffs & Worcs Canal to the Wyrley and Essington Canal. Closed after the war it is now under restoration by the Lichfield and Hatherton Canals Trust.

images.title: John M / Across the Pelsall Common North Nature Reserve
images.caption: Across the Pelsall Common North Nature Reserve. A man and his dog head off towards the Hatherton Branch Canal.

images.title: John M / Timberland Trail, Forest of Mercia
images.caption: Timberland Trail, Forest of Mercia. The trail runs across Pelsall Common.

images.title: John M / Pelsall Common Bridge, Hatherton Branch Canal
images.caption: Canal view at the northern edge of the common

description: This walk visits the Pelsall North Common nature reserve in the village of Pelsall, Walsall. The reserve includes some pleasant footpaths with woodland, heathland, wildlife and ponds. The Wyrley and Essington Canal also runs through the reserve so you can pick up the towpath and enjoy some easy waterside walking here. You can extend your walk by heading south to visit Pelsall Village Comon where there are more pleasant trails.
display_address: Wood Lane, Old Town, Little Bloxwich, Pelsall, Walsall, West Midlands, England, WS3 5DZ, United Kingdom
